title.narrative: RITU

description.narrative:
general description
Ritu (which means ‘season’ and is also used to indicate menstruation in Bangladesh) is a programme that aims to promote improved Menstrual Health (MH) among school-going in Bangladesh. The programme is designed and will be implemented by Simavi (a Dutch Health NGO), RedOrange (a social media company) and TNO (a Dutch technology and research company). The programme is funded by the Royal Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands. Program timeline: 42 Months starts from November 2015
objectives description Impact • Improved health and well-being, and social and economic participation girls in Bangladesh. Specific objective • Improve menstrual hygiene and related well-being of girls (10 – 13 years) in Netrokona. Outcomes • Increased knowledge and improved attitudes and practice on menstrual hygiene of girls, boys, men and women. • Increased commitment towards menstrual hygiene management by the government and civil society in Bangladesh. • Women and girls have access to better MHM facilities at schools and affordable (biodegradable) sanitary napkins. (als teveel tekst, outcomes weglaten)
target groups description
Primary target group: School-going girls from grade 5 – grade 8, in the age from 10-13.
Secondary target groups: - School going boys - Fathers and men - Mothers and women - Teachers of the school-going girls and boys - Society at large (media campaign) - Government of Bangladesh (advocacy)
